Articles.Content:
So if I download KW and this mod will I instantly get the old fairing pieces back?

Yes, if you have KW (and remember the old fairing parts in in a separate folder in the ZIP file) and this mod then old fairings will work again.

Yes, if you have KW (and remember the old fairing parts in in a separate folder in the ZIP file) and this mod then old fairings will work again.

Will try this again when i get my computer back
How do you think 1.0.5 is going to impact this mod?

How do you think 1.0.5 is going to impact this mod?

There are no aero changes related to fairings, so I don't think it will affect this at all. We'll still need it for old fairing, and it will still function for them.
You Sir are a steely eyed missile man i hate procedural fairings with a passion I loved the KW fairing and now I can use them again lots of rep for you

You Sir are a steely eyed missile man i hate procedural fairings with a passion I loved the KW fairing and now I can use them again lots of rep for you

Thanks. I too hate procedural fairings.
Removed the proc fairing from KW and replace with the old ones and now i dont get engine shrouds anyone else experiencing this
Nope, but last i knew, all my rockets were literally doing backflips
Hey Felbourn, could you maybe add support for the ModuleAnchoredDecoupler partmodule? That would be awesome!
This mod is already derived from that module.
Sorry, newbie here. Does this mod need KW fairings? Thanks.....
You'd need a mod that has fairings. KW and Lanchers Pack both have the fairings. Go DL KW or Launchers pack .

18 hours ago, sharpspoonful said:

You'd need a mod that has fairings. KW and Lanchers Pack both have the fairings. Go DL KW or Launchers pack .

Doesn't Launchers Pack need Old School fairings as one of its requirements? Soo if I download Old School Fairings and then Launchers Pack, I will have the fairings?

Many thanks.....
pretty much. this mod allows for the fairings in older parts pack to actually work.

Do the AIES fairings work with this plugin installed? My rocket keeps on flipping if I travel more than 300m/s at an altitude of 10km or lower.

Maybe it's an issue with the reaction wheels, but I'm suspecting the fairings...

Edited January 27, 2016 by Delta_8930

It's probably the fairing. You can check by pressing F12 during flight and try to scroll he camera into the fairing. If you see red arrows coming off your payload parts then it's the payload and fairing. Yes, this mod should work on AIES fairings. Actually... let me double check the ZIP file and make sure those CFGs are actually in there....

Yes, I see that I had included AIES, KW, and HGR fairing support.

Edited January 27, 2016 by Felbourn

After looking at the AIES config, I found that it had a line that said @PART [top?00a1ur5*] which is not the name of the part. The MM config data for the other fairing bases and fairings are missing. That's probably the reason why my rockets keep on flipping even with this plugin installed. 

I will try to add the new fairing data to the config...though I'll still need to find the data of the drag cubes and such...

Edited January 28, 2016 by Delta_8930
I should have listed all the fairings by hand instead of being tricky...

I need a config for Bobcats American Pack  if someone can help

Edited January 29, 2016 by Virtualgenius
I thought the American Pack link was dead. Where can we find the parts you need a config for?
Its only dead because its a media fire link and they have blocked them I have pm you with a solution

The blocking was not fooled by your PM. I have a VERY OLD AmericanPack. Maybe the part name is the same. I see AresV_payload_shroud. Do you mean that? A CFG for that part would look like this: 

@PART[AresV_payload_shroud]
{
    @MODULE[ModuleDecouple]
    {
        @name = ModuleFairingDecoupler
    }
}

Well, I've listed all of the AIES fairings and bases, but I can't figure out how to add the drag cubes. Here they are:

basepunta1ur5 (base)

basepuntv2r10 (base)

(the rest are fairings)

t1000v4

t1500v4

t2000v4

topb1

top100a1ur5

top100a1ur5b

top500a1ur5

Yea, I did the drag cubes by hand, and it was not a trivial process figuring out what they should be. I'd need to spend quite a bit of time building and testing AIES rockets to get them all done. I can't promise getting to this soon because I am working on Project Alexandria 1968 at the moment. You can probably ignore the drag cubes unless you need absolutely perfect performance. KSP takes its best guess when they are missing, and the guess is not horrible.

OK thanks if you where to take a look at the link you will see that the media fire domain name is missing after the www. put it back in a seperate browser window and it will work  but i will try the config you provided as there is the orion fairing as well but i will try and get it to work 

Edited January 30, 2016 by Virtualgenius
